noun.description: Reasoning conducted or assessed according to strict principles of validity.
examples: experience is a better guide to this than deductive logic
the logic of the argument is faulty
he explains his move with simple logic

noun.description: A system or set of principles underlying the arrangements of elements in a computer or electronic device so as to perform a specified task.

origin: Late Middle English: via Old French logique and late Latin logica from Greek logikē (tekhnē) (art) of reason, from logos word, reason.
